title: APP protein characterization
context: Characterize amyloid beta precursor protein with sequence, structure, and literature context.

steps.query: Retrieve UniProt entry for amyloid beta precursor protein (APP) by accession
Get protein sequence for APP to map to structure
Find PDB sequence for APP-related structure
Literature search for APP and Alzheimer disease

title: EGFR target context
context: Use HPA and Open Targets to build localization and interaction context for EGFR.

steps.query: Get Human Protein Atlas basic gene info for EGFR by Ensembl ID
Subcellular location for EGFR protein
Protein interactions for EGFR
Gene ontology terms for EGFR target

title: Parkinson disease target discovery
context: Use Open Targets to map a disease to candidate targets and evidence.

steps.query: Find targets associated with Parkinson disease EFO
Get interaction partners for a Parkinson disease target by Ensembl ID
Search literature for Parkinson disease target evidence

title: Imatinib mechanism and analogs
context: Use Open Targets and ChEMBL to profile drug mechanism and related molecules.

steps.query: Get mechanisms of action for imatinib by ChEMBL ID
Diseases associated with imatinib from Open Targets
Find similar molecules to imatinib
Literature for imatinib mechanism of action

title: Warfarin safety context
context: Compare label-reported adverse reactions with FAERS counts.

steps.query: Find adverse reactions for warfarin in FDA labels
Search DailyMed SPL for warfarin
Count FAERS reactions for warfarin event

title: Type 2 diabetes GWAS evidence
context: Use GWAS catalog and Open Targets to connect trait associations to targets.

steps.query: GWAS associations for type 2 diabetes
SNPs for a diabetes-associated gene
Targets associated with type 2 diabetes EFO

title: Caspase-3 pathway context
context: Connect UniProt functional annotation to pathway context and literature.

steps.query: UniProt function for caspase-3 protein
Reactome pathway reactions for apoptosis
Literature search for caspase-3 apoptosis

title: Structure to UniProt mapping
context: Use PDB and UniProt sequence retrieval to map structure back to canonical sequence.

steps.query: Retrieve sequence from PDB ID 1AKE
Retrieve UniProt sequence for the corresponding protein
UniProt entry for the protein
